name: Violence Against Women Discretionary Grants for Indian Tribal Governments
objective: To increase tribal capacity to respond to violent crimes against Indian women, and to develop and strengthen victim services in cases involving violent crimes against Indian women.
applicant_types: Native American Organizations (includes Indian groups, cooperatives, corporations, partnerships, associations)
categories: Law, Justice, and Legal Services - Tribal Independence and Autonomy
rules_regulations: Program notices of funding opportunities (NOFOs) can be found at https://www.justice.gov/ovw/open-notices-of-funding-opportunities. Recipients must comply with the current version of the DOJ Financial Grants Management Guide found at https://www.justice.gov/ovw/grant-management.

pons.pon: Improve Sexual Assault Response on Tribal Lands
Increase Tribal Self-Governance and Decision-Making Authority
